intro: Sedum morotii, commonly known as the Morotii stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to full sun exposure. Sedum morotii is a low-maintenance plant that is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its hardy nature.
